createService.title: New Service
createService.name: Name:
createService.containerHelp: Select one or more containers from the list.
createService.weekdaysHelp: All days are active by default. You can disable individual days, but at least one day must remain selected.
createService.timeWindowHelp: You can specify only start time, only end time, or both values. Empty fields mean no time restrictions on selected days.

proxyNotification.title: Proxy Configuration Required
proxyNotification.message: Since you've specified both Host and Target URL, you need to configure your external proxy (nginx, Apache, etc.) to forward requests to Conslee. See the Help section for detailed instructions.

errors.hostInvalid: Domain must be specified without protocol, e.g.: app.example.com
errors.targetInvalid: Target URL must be a valid http or https address
errors.idleTimeoutInvalid: Specify time in format: 1m, 30s, 1h2m (minutes, seconds, hours)
errors.startTimeInvalid: Start time must be in HH:MM format
errors.stopTimeInvalid: Stop time must be in HH:MM format
errors.healthPathInvalid: Health check path must start with "/"

serviceCard.containerHelp: Select one or more containers from the list. Already selected containers are displayed above.
serviceCard.targetUrlHelp: Internal service address for proxying. For example:
serviceCard.idleTimeoutHelp: Idle time after which the service will be stopped. Format: number + time unit (s, m, h). Examples:
serviceCard.startupTimeoutHelp: Maximum time to wait for successful service startup. Format: number + time unit (s, m, h). For example:
serviceCard.weekdaysHelp: Select one or more weekdays. All days are active by default.
serviceCard.timeWindowHelp: Time is specified in 24-hour format. Fields can be left empty.
serviceCard.healthPathHelp: Relative path for service health check. For example:
serviceCard.healthPathHelp3: Leave empty to disable health check.
serviceCard.toggleHelp: Disabling the service stops proxying, scheduling, and background tasks.
serviceCard.proxyUnhealthyWarning: Reverse proxy ({{host}}) is not responding. Check nginx/apache routing between the proxy and your application.
serviceCard.targetUnhealthyWarning: The application gets no response from the container at {{target}}. Check the Target URL and container state.

systemSettings.title: System Settings
systemSettings.listenAddrHelp: Address and port where Conslee will accept incoming connections. For example:
systemSettings.portSaved: Port saved. Server is restarting, redirecting to new port...
systemSettings.idleReaperIntervalHelp: Interval at which idle services are checked and stopped. Format: number + time unit (s, m, h). For example:

proxy.title: Proxy Configuration
proxy.intro: For Conslee to track traffic and work in 'on demand' mode, you need to configure your external proxy (nginx, Apache, etc.) to forward requests to Conslee instead of directly to containers. This allows Conslee to detect when services are accessed and automatically start containers.
proxy.importantPoint1: Change the proxy to point to Conslee's listen address (check System Settings, default is :8800)
proxy.importantPoint2: In the service configuration, set targetUrl to what was previously in the proxy (the container's port)
proxy.importantPoint3: If your proxy uses HTTPS, use HTTP in the proxy (proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8800), but set HTTPS in the service's targetUrl (https://127.0.0.1:9000)

nginx.title: Nginx Configuration
nginx.description: If you previously had proxy_pass pointing directly to a container (e.g., http://127.0.0.1:9000), change it to point to Conslee. Example configuration:
nginx.upstream: For convenience, you can use upstream:

apache.title: Apache Configuration
apache.description: If you previously had ProxyPass pointing directly to a container, change it to point to Conslee. Example:
apache.exampleBefore:
# Before (direct to container):
ProxyPass / http://127.0.0.1:9000/
ProxyPassReverse / http://127.0.0.1:9000/
apache.exampleAfter:
# After (via Conslee):
ProxyPreserveHost On
ProxyPass / http://127.0.0.1:8800/  # Conslee's listen address
ProxyPassReverse / http://127.0.0.1:8800/

<Proxy *>
    Require all granted
</Proxy>

targetUrl.title: Service targetUrl Configuration
targetUrl.description: In the service settings, set targetUrl to the address that was previously in your proxy:
targetUrl.example1:
If proxy was: proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:9000
Then targetUrl: http://127.0.0.1:9000
targetUrl.example2:
If proxy was HTTPS but you changed it to HTTP for Conslee:
Proxy: proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:8800
TargetUrl: https://127.0.0.1:9000  # Use HTTPS here

creating.title: Creating a Service
creating.step1: Click the 'Add' button in the header
creating.step2: Enter a service name. For 'On demand' or 'Both' modes, also specify the domain (Host) that will be used to access the service
creating.step3: Select one or more Docker containers that should be started
creating.step4: For 'On demand' or 'Both' modes, configure the Target URL (internal address where the service runs, e.g., http://127.0.0.1:8800). For 'Schedule only' mode, Host and Target URL are optional - if omitted, Conslee will only manage containers by schedule without proxying
creating.step5: Set the mode, timeouts, and optional schedule according to your needs

modes.title: Service Modes
modes.onDemandDesc: Service starts automatically when accessed and stops after the idle timeout. Requires Host and Target URL to be configured.
modes.scheduleOnlyDesc: Service only runs according to the schedule. Host and Target URL are optional - if not specified, Conslee will not proxy requests and only manage containers by schedule. Requests to the site will not start containers.
modes.bothDesc: Service can be started on demand and also follows the schedule. Requires Host and Target URL to be configured.

timeouts.title: Timeouts
timeouts.idleDesc: Time after which an inactive service will be stopped. Format: number + unit (s, m, h). Example: 15m, 1h30m
timeouts.startupDesc: Maximum time to wait for containers to start and become ready. Format: number + unit (s, m, h). Example: 30s, 2m

scheduling.title: Scheduling
scheduling.description: You can configure services to run on specific days and time windows. Select weekdays and optionally set start/stop times. Empty time fields mean no time restrictions for selected days.

healthCheck.title: Health Check
healthCheck.description: Optionally specify a health check path (e.g., /health, /api/status). Conslee will check this endpoint to verify the service is ready before routing traffic. Leave empty to disable health checks.

proxyIssue.title: Proxy Layer Issues
proxyIssue.description: If you see 'Proxy layer issue' warnings:
proxyIssue.check1: Verify that your external proxy (nginx/Apache) is correctly forwarding requests to Conslee
proxyIssue.check2: Check that Conslee is running and listening on the configured address (check System Settings)
proxyIssue.check3: Ensure the Host header is being forwarded correctly from your external proxy

containerIssue.title: Container Layer Issues
containerIssue.description: If you see 'Container layer issue' warnings:
containerIssue.check1: Verify the Target URL is correct and the service is accessible at that address
containerIssue.check2: Check that the Docker containers are running and healthy
containerIssue.check3: Ensure the containers are listening on the correct ports specified in Target URL

support.title: Support the Project
support.intro: The development of Conslee depends on your support. Your contributions help us improve the project, add new features, and maintain the infrastructure.
